perturbation.original_text: e)   "Excite@Home Member(s)" shall mean a User who has registered as a           member of the Excite@Home Network, regardless of that User's stated           preference regarding allowing their registration information to be           shared with third parties.
perturbation.changed_text: e)   "Excite@Home Member(s)" shall mean a User who has registered as a           member of the Excite@Home Network, but only if that User has given consent to allow their registration information to be shared with third parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition includes all registered users, regardless of their privacy preferences. The modified definition adds a condition requiring consent for data sharing, which directly contradicts the 'regardless' clause and introduces ambiguity about who qualifies as a member.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Data privacy laws such as the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) which mandate explicit consent for data sharing.

perturbation.original_text: vi)   Application Provider will not solicit any Excite@Home Member on             behalf of any Excite@Home Named Competitor during the Term of this             Agreement or thereafter. The list of Excite@Home Named Competitors             is defined in EXHIBIT E.
perturbation.changed_text: vi)   Application Provider may solicit any Excite@Home Member on             behalf of any Excite@Home Named Competitor during the Term of this             Agreement or thereafter, so long as that competitor is not listed in EXHIBIT E. The list of Excite@Home Approved Competitors is defined in EXHIBIT E.
perturbation.explanation: This flips the restriction on solicitation, suggesting it's allowed unless explicitly prohibited. This contradicts the original intent and creates confusion about competitive restrictions. The term 'Named Competitors' was replaced with 'Approved Competitors', making this new definition conflict with the definition and application of competitors as intended by the drafter.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Antitrust laws preventing unfair competitive advantages.

perturbation.original_text: b)   Either party's liability for damages shall be limited to the amounts           actually paid by the other party.
perturbation.changed_text: b)   Either party's liability for damages shall be limited to the amounts that the responsible party has been found to have at the time of the damage or loss, which is determined by the responsible party's financial standing.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause sets a clear monetary limit based on payments exchanged. The modified version introduces a vague concept tied to the 'financial standing' of the responsible party. The original, definitive clause for damage liability is conflicted by the financial standing of either party, making a huge difference in either party's responsibility.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract and damages claims; conflicts with the concept of agreed-upon limitations of liability.
